intro: Atriplex candicans, commonly known as white gooseweed, is a flowering plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in harsh environments. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically wind-pollinated. It thrives in sandy or saline soils and is often found in desert scrub and coastal dunes. Atriplex candicans is also known for its ability to tolerate extreme temperatures and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
